item.title: About Me
item.description: Biography I am a PhD candidate in the Interactive Intelligence Group at TU Delft and part of the Hybrid Intelligence Centre. I obtained cum laude MSc. in Systems and Control from TU Delft (The Netherlands, 2017) and cum laude BSc. in Automation Engineering from the University of Bologna (Italy, 2015). Between my MSc. studies and the current position, I worked for 2.5 years as deep learning developer and technical project lead at Fizyr (the Netherlands).

item.title: Publications
item.description: 2023 Enrico Liscio, Roger Lera-Leri, Filippo Bistaffa, Roel I.J. Dobbe, Catholijn M. Jonker, Maite Lopez-Sanchez, Juan A. Rodriguez-Aguilar, Pradeep K. Murukannaiah. 2023. Value Inference in Sociotechnical Systems: Blue Sky Ideas Track. In Proc. of the 22nd International Conference on Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems (AAMAS ‘23), London, United Kingdom, IFAAMAS, 1-7. [paper] 2022 Enrico Liscio, Alin E. Dondera, Andrei Geadau, Catholijn M.
